columns.characteristic_type_code: A unique identifier for each characteristic type, used to categorize and reference specific attributes.
columns.characteristic_type_description: A textual description providing additional context about the characteristic type, detailing its significance or application.

Ref_Characteristic_Types.table_description: The Ref_Characteristic_Types table serves as a reference for various types of product characteristics, providing unique codes and descriptions for attributes that can be associated with products.

columns.color_code: A unique identifier for each color, used to reference the color in related tables.
columns.color_description: A textual representation of the color, providing a human-readable name for each color code.

Ref_Colors.table_description: The Ref_Colors table serves as a reference for color identification and description, ensuring consistency and clarity across related product entries.

columns.product_category_code: A unique identifier for each product category, representing classifications such as Herbs, Seeds, and Spices.
columns.product_category_description: A brief textual description of the product category, providing clarity on the nature of the products it encompasses.
columns.unit_of_measure: The standard measurement unit used for quantifying products within the respective category, such as weight or volume.

Ref_Product_Categories.table_description: The Ref_Product_Categories table serves to categorize various product types related to botanical goods, allowing for organized inventory management and clear communication of product attributes.

columns.product_characteristic_value: This column represents the value of the characteristic associated with a product, indicating specific attributes such as quality or performance level.
columns.characteristic_id: This column identifies the characteristic type that is being described, linking to specific characteristics defined in the system.
columns.product_id: This column indicates the unique identifier for the product to which the characteristic is associated, linking it to the product catalog.

Product_Characteristics.table_description: The Product_Characteristics table serves to relate various products to their specific characteristics, allowing for an organized way to describe and analyze product attributes.

columns.characteristic_id: A unique identifier for each characteristic entry in the table.
columns.characteristic_type_code: A code representing the type of characteristic, linking to a reference table for predefined types.
columns.characteristic_data_type: The format or nature of the data that the characteristic represents.
columns.characteristic_name: The name or label associated with the characteristic, describing its specific attribute.
columns.other_characteristic_details: Any additional details or notes relevant to the characteristic, which may provide further context.

Characteristics.table_description: The Characteristics table is designed to store various product characteristics, providing a structured way to define and categorize different attributes that products may possess.

columns.product_id: Unique identifier for each product in the table.
columns.color_code: Code representing the color of the product, linked to a reference table of colors.
columns.product_category_code: Code representing the category of the product, linked to a reference table of product categories.
columns.product_name: The name of the product as it will be known in the market.
columns.typical_buying_price: Standard price for which the product is typically purchased.
columns.typical_selling_price: Standard price at which the product is typically sold.
columns.product_description: A brief description providing details about the product.
columns.other_product_details: Additional details about the product that are not captured in other columns.

Products.table_description: The Products table serves to catalog various items available for sale, providing essential information about each product, including identifiers, pricing, descriptions, and categorization.
